title: Moonlight
provenance_text:
Ralph Albert Blakelock [1847-1919]. Catholina Lambert [1834-1923], Belle Vista Castle, Paterson, NJ, by February 1916; Lambert sale, American Art Association, Plaza Hotel, New York, NY, February 21, 1916 until February 24, 1916, no. 140 [1]; William Macbeth, New York, NY [2]; purchased by Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, March 1916 [3]. 

Notes:
[1]. "The Valuable Paintings and Sculptures by the Old and Modern Masters Forming the Famous Catholina Lambert Collection." Listed as "Landscape" and illustrated in the catalogue. The painting sold on the second day of the sale, February 22, 1916.
[2]. Acting as agent for Carnegie Institute. 
[3]. The painting was received at the museum from William Macbeth on February 26, 1916; it was accessioned on March 8, 1916.

creator.death_place: Elizabethtown (Essex county, New York state, United States)
